def: To convert into soap, as tallow or any fat; hence (Chem.), tosubject to any similar process, as that which ethereal salts undergoin decomposition; as, to saponify ethyl acetate.
Having the quality of softening or mitigating, as pain oracrimony; assuasive; emollient.

Present letters or instrument, as a deed of conveyance, alease, letter of attorney, or other writing; as in the phrase, " Knowall men by these presents," that is, by the writing itself, " per hasliteras praesentes; " -- in this sense, rarely used in the singular.
A woman who corrupts.Thou studied old corruptress. Beau & Fl.
A sudden awkening associated with a sensation of terror,occurring in children, esp. those of unstable nervous constitution.
To make steady; to hold or keep from shaking, reeling, orfalling; to make or keep firm; to support; to make constant, regular,or resolute.
Carryng on war in conjunction with another power.
To reply, as a plaintiff to a defendant's rebutter.
To make designs in art, according to conventional principles.Cf. Conventionalize, v. t., 2.
